column4: ok, so i installed the restricted driver from the system menu for my nvidia graphics card. worked great. had it all set up how i wanted.
then, for giggles, i installed the latest driver from the nvidia site, now I cannot get it to work right.
everything is in low res
i just copied my good xorg.conf into place, but it does not like it
where did i screw up?
when compiling a driver from nvidia's site, you should be awared that if you'd perform kernel upgrades, you will end up in text mode after reboot and you'd need to rebuild it again
I did not understand what you just told me.
the driver that you are talking about
how do i rebuild the driver? I just installed what I downloaded
did you follow the steps on how to install it?
Is there more than just running the installer? new to ubuntu... everywhere else you just install it and configure your xorg.conf
last time i compiled an nvidia driver, there was loads of things to do
where can i find instructions on ubuntu install then... cuz everywhere else all i have had to do is run the installer then configure the xorg

after sh file.run i still remember you reboot and then follow steps to install
I have a working xorg.conf... it just does not work with the my latest installation
you don't need all those guides.
I have it all figured out except for how to get windows installed ;-) I know this is not the place for that. It looks like an issue with my sata drive. xp does not recognize it.
i didn't get how you can't get vista get installed and trying to make the grub boot the uninstalled vista
i mean X{
if you got sata drive no being detected, i would assume you are running a mercury via chipset mainboard
